title: GIS Curriculum (QGIS • Environmental • Texas Hill Country)
description: Checklist + project guide for learning QGIS and environmental GIS workflows, focused on Edwards & Real Counties in the Texas Hill Country.

phases.title: Phase 1 — Foundations (Global → Local)
phases.description: Install tools, understand vector/raster basics, and make first maps (global + Texas Hill Country).

tasks.text: Install QGIS (LTR). Enable QuickMapServices, Semi-Automatic Classification, DataPlotly, Raster Terrain Analysis plugins.
Create project folder tree: raw_data/ (vectors, rasters, satellite), processed_data/, scripts/, outputs/, metadata/.
Download starter global datasets: Natural Earth (boundaries, rivers), ESA WorldCover (10 m), SRTM DEM.
Download local datasets for Edwards & Real Counties: boundaries, hydrography, DEMs (TNRIS, National Map, TWDB, TPWD, LANDFIRE).
Milestone: First Maps — (a) Global land cover + admin boundaries; (b) Edwards/Real shaded relief with hydrography.

phases.title: Phase 2 — Terrain & Hydrology
phases.description: Work with elevation data, derive hydrologic layers, and delineate watersheds.

tasks.text: Download 1/3 arc-sec (~10 m) DEM tiles for Edwards/Real; mosaic if needed.
Generate hillshade, slope, and aspect rasters; style them for interpretation.
Extract flow direction/accumulation; derive stream network and pour points.
Milestone: Delineate the Nueces River watershed inside Edwards/Real; summarize slope classes.

phases.title: Phase 3 — Habitat & Land Cover
phases.description: Analyze vegetation/habitat distribution; quantify fragmentation near roads & rivers.

tasks.text: Acquire LANDFIRE vegetation + ESA WorldCover for the counties.
Compute class areas by county using Zonal Statistics.
Create buffers (e.g., 250–500 m) around primary roads; intersect with habitat to estimate fragmentation.
Milestone: Map oak–juniper woodlands vs rangeland; report % within buffers and in protected areas (TPWD layers).

phases.title: Phase 4 — Remote Sensing & Vegetation Indices
phases.description: Use Sentinel-2/Landsat imagery to compute NDVI and detect seasonal or long-term change.

tasks.text: Download cloud-free Sentinel-2 scenes (summer/winter) for Real County.
Compute NDVI (NIR-Red)/(NIR+Red); create styled NDVI maps.
Compare NDVI distributions (summer vs winter); export charts (DataPlotly).
Milestone: Long-term change — Landsat 1995 vs 2025 to assess woody encroachment (juniper).

phases.title: Phase 5 — Applied Environmental Challenges
phases.description: Integrate multi-layer analyses for conservation/water resources in the Hill Country.

tasks.text: Aquifer Recharge: Overlay karst geology (Edwards Aquifer outcrops), precipitation (PRISM), slope; find likely recharge zones.
Flood Risk: Combine DEM-derived flow paths with rainfall intensity; map flood-prone corridors along Nueces/Frio.
Habitat Suitability: Weight land cover, slope, distance to water/roads; produce a suitability raster.
Milestone: Conservation Plan — map priority restoration areas and export a report/map series.

phases.title: Phase 6 — Automation & Scaling
phases.description: Automate workflows with PyQGIS; scale to larger extents; share web maps.

tasks.text: Write a PyQGIS script to batch-export NDVI for all scenes in a folder; save PNG + CSV stats.
Automate a county map series with QGIS Atlas; export PDFs to outputs/atlas/.
Optional: Load layers into PostGIS; run spatial SQL for summaries.
Milestone: Build a simple web map from QGIS via qgis2web (Leaflet).
